t: Isaiah 63
The Lord in Judgment and Salvation

Who*pn is*i this who comes from Edom, With*ld dyed garments from Bozrah, This*ld One*i who*i is*i glorious in His apparel, Traveling*ld in the greatness of His strength?— “I*ln who speak in righteousness, mighty to save.”
Why*ln is*i Your apparel red, And*ld Your garments like one who treads in the winepress?

“I*ln have trodden the winepress alone, And*ld from the peoples no one was*i with Me. For*ld I have trodden them in My anger, And*ld trampled them in My fury; Their*ld blood is sprinkled upon My garments, And*ld I have stained all My robes.
For*ld the day of vengeance is*i in My heart, And*ld the year of My redeemed has come.
I*ld looked, but there*i was*i no one to help, And*ld I wondered That*ld there*i was*i no one to uphold; Therefore*ld My own arm brought salvation for Me; And*ld My own fury, it sustained Me.
I*ld have trodden down the peoples in My anger, Made*ld them drunk in My fury, And*ld brought down their strength to the earth.”
God’s Mercy Remembered

I*pn will mention the lovingkindnesses of the Lord*s And*ild the praises of the Lord,*s According*ld to all that the Lord*s has bestowed on us, And*ld the great goodness toward the house of Israel, Which*ld He has bestowed on them according to His mercies, According*ld to the multitude of His lovingkindnesses.
For*ld He said, “Surely they are*i My people, Children*ld who*i will not lie.” So*ld He became their Savior.
In*ld all their affliction He was afflicted, And*ld the Angel of His Presence saved them; In*ld His love and in His pity He redeemed them; And*ld He bore them and carried them All*ld the days of old.
But*ld they rebelled and grieved His Holy Spirit; So*ld He turned Himself against them as an enemy, And*ild He fought against them.

Then*ln he remembered the days of old, Moses*ld and*i his people, saying:*i “Where*ld is*i He who brought them up out of the sea With*ld the shepherd of His flock? Where*ld is*i He who put His Holy Spirit within them,
Who*ld led them*i by the right hand of Moses, With*ld His glorious arm, Dividing*ld the water before them To*ld make for Himself an everlasting name,
Who*ld led them through the deep, As*ld a horse in the wilderness, That*ild they might not stumble?”
As*ln a beast goes down into the valley, And*ild the Spirit of the Lord*s causes him to rest, So*ld You lead Your people, To*ld make Yourself a glorious name.
A Prayer of Penitence

Look*pn down from heaven, And*ld see from Your habitation, holy and glorious. Where*ld are*i Your zeal and Your strength, The*ld yearning of Your heart and Your mercies toward me? Are*ld they restrained?
Doubtless*ld You are*i our Father, Though*ld Abraham was ignorant of us, And*ld Israel does not acknowledge us. You,*ld O Lord,*s are*i our Father; Our*ld Redeemer from Everlasting is*i Your name.
O*ld Lord,*s why have You made us stray from Your ways, And*ild hardened our heart from Your fear? Return*ld for Your servants’ sake, The*ld tribes of Your inheritance.
Your*ld holy people have possessed it*i but a little while; Our*ld adversaries have trodden down Your sanctuary.
We*ld have become like*i those of old, over whom You never ruled, Those*ld who were never called by Your name.
